root.name: rect()
root.description:
Draws a rectangle to the screen. A rectangle is a four-sided shape with every angle at ninety degrees. By default, the first two parameters set the location of the upper-left corner, the third sets the width, and the fourth sets the height. These parameters may be changed with the rectMode() function.

The version of rect() with eight parameters can draw a rounded rectangle. The second group of four parameters sets the radius of the arc at each corner, starting with the top-left corner and moving clockwise around the rectangle. The r parameter is a shortcut to set the radii of all corners to the same value.
